meanings.definition: The process of becoming or making something hard or harder.
meanings.sent1: The hardening of the clay made it difficult to mold into shapes.
meanings.sent2: The hardening of the metal was necessary to create a durable tool.
meanings.sent3: The hardening of the ice cream in the freezer turned it into a solid block.
meanings.sent4: The hardening of his heart towards her pleas left her feeling alone.
meanings.sent5: The hardening of the cement under the sun made it as strong as rock.

meanings.definition: The act of becoming more severe or inflexible.
meanings.sent1: The hardening of his attitude towards the rules surprised his friends.
meanings.sent2: The hardening of the policy led to stricter regulations in the company.
meanings.sent3: The hardening of the teacher's tone made the students pay attention.
meanings.sent4: The hardening of the criminal's resolve to escape made him more dangerous.
meanings.sent5: The hardening of the weather conditions forced everyone to stay indoors.

meanings.definition: The act of becoming more determined or resolute.
meanings.sent1: The hardening of her resolve to succeed fueled her efforts.
meanings.sent2: The hardening of his determination to finish the race kept him going.
meanings.sent3: The hardening of their commitment to the project brought them closer together.
meanings.sent4: The hardening of his decision to confront his fears surprised his friends.
meanings.sent5: The hardening of her willpower to resist temptation impressed her peers.
